channel.title: Question on Netbeans
channel.description:
Hi i am downlaoding netbeans and i dont want to use 700mb of space to download everything that is checked. Which ones do i REALLY need to code? [code] BASE IDE JAVA SE JAVA EE JAVA ME JAVA CARD 3 CONNECTED C/C++ GROOVY PHP FEATURES ON DEMAND [/code]
[b]RUNTIMES[/b] [code]GLASSFISH SERVER OPEN SOURCE EDITION 3.1 APACHE TOMCAT 7.0.11 [/code]
Thank you

item.title: Question on Netbeans
item.dc:creator: @Xata27 Xata27
item.description:
@Xata27 wrote:

You want only want Java SE for now, you can download C/C++ support or PHP and Ruby Support later if you need it. Java SE is only for Java development.

Read full topic

item.title: Question on Netbeans
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

Java SE - Standard Edition - If you’re just going to work with java for desktop applications all you need is this. RSPS’s use this as I’m assuming this is why you are asking.
Java EE - Enterprise Edition - Used for server programming.
Java ME - Micro Edition - Used from developing mobile applications.
C/C++ - A language completely separate and has no relation to java.
Groovy - I believe this is a scripting language or something similar that is often used with java.
PHP - A language to develop web pages.

Basically its the different compilers that its going to include in the IDE so that you can use it for both as an example Java and C++ programs. So again all you need is the IDE with Java SE

Read full topic

item.title: Question on Netbeans
item.dc:creator: @Tu1 Tu
item.description:
@Tu1 wrote:

all you need is java standard edition if you are a java programmer unless you want to use those other things i have no idea what they are because i do not use that language

Read full topic
